result.execSummary:
The defendant James R. Nachreiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. James R. Nachreiner is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • James R. Nachreiner was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber privileges.  Jail may be served in prison.  DNA sample to be provided.
Consecutive to: to 12CF225

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James R. Nachreiner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James R. Nachreiner in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant James R. Nachreiner in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and parties state appearances.  Atty Covey states there is a global agreement and the PSI would be waived.  State notes mother of the victim in the 2012 case is present and she would like to read a statement.  Court would like to hear the agreement first.  Atty Covey states they don't object to revocation of the DPA in 12CF225.  Court grants motion to revoke DPA in 12CF225 Ct 1 and finds DE guilty.  Atty Covey states agreement.  State is in agreement.  DE also agrees.  Atty Covey enters guilty plea to Ct 1 of 15CF233.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty.  Victim witness coordinator reads statement of victim's mother.  State makes statement.  Atty Covey makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  Court advises DE of voting rights/felony firearms warnings.

15CF233
Ct 1:  Guilty
90 days jail consecutive to sentence in 12CF225 and may be served in prison 
Costs of $443.00 to be paid w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA sample to be provided 
Ct 2:  Dismissed

12CF225 - DPA revoked on Ct 1
Ct 1:  9 1/2 years prison (4 1/2 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision) to commence forthwith concurrent to Ct 3 but consecutive to any other
Ct 3:  Probation revoked
8 years prison (3 years initial confinement and 5 years extended supervision) to be concurrent to Ct 1 but consecutive to any other
Not eligible for ERP or CIP
279 days credit on Ct 3 only**
Conditions of extended supervision:  (same as previously ordered on probation)
Counseling/treatment/evaluations per agent
AODA/treatment
No contact w/CBH or his family or his residence or his school
25% of wages/funds in prison to be placed toward restitution first and then court costs
No unsupervised contact w/minors under 18 other than his own children
Absolute sobriety at all times from alcohol and controlled substances
Restitution/surcharges and court costs as previously ordered in Ct 3 only
Costs in Ct 1 of $268.00 to be paid as a condition
DNA sample already provided
Not to possess/consume any controlled substances w/o valid prescription
Atty Covey acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Bond continued.

Defendant James R. Nachreiner in court with attorney Michael Edward Covey.  Defendant James R. Nachreiner in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Covey states DE will waive his right to prelim in 15CF233 today.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.  State notes 12CF case is a DPA which is being revoked and will need a hefty time slot to do the sentencing.  15CF is a Br 2 case and 12CF is a Br 1 case.  Attorney's will  work that out.

Defendant James R. Nachreiner in court with attorney Debra Van Wormer O'Rourke.  Defendant James R. Nachreiner in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney ORourke request reset 1-2 weeks.  State has no objection.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 07-17-2015 10:00 am.
Return date at 07-30-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant James R. Nachreiner appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney. State requests $1500 Cash.  DE has not applied for PD representation yet.   Atty. ORourke requests PA bond.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $1000 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No possession of controlled substances  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
